channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Two potholes, around 8 inches each, 3rd February
item.description:
Two potholes have formed where previously reported repairs have not been carried out. No markings on the highway by a highway inspector which illustrates that this road has not been inspected. These two potholes need to be fixed as a matter of extreme urgency, this is a danger to pedestrians and vehicles.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thursland Road, North Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Chair still here despite saying resolved, 3rd February
item.description:
Still here even though it says it’s been taken?

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Wilton Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Hedge overhanging and obstructing pavement, 3rd February
item.description:
This issue was originally reported by me :FixMyStreet ref: 8038697. Hedges at nos 3 and 5 were overhanging and obstructing the pavement. No 3 has now been cut back but no action has been taken on no 5. You have however indicated the case is now closed. Can you please re-open as the matter had not been resolved. Or explain why you have decided not to take any action.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Way, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin bags left, 3rd February
item.description:
There are 4 bags of rubbish on the pavement at the end of Tyler St, next to the railway line. I think these are left from the street cleaners when clearing leaves. Other bags have been collected but I think these have been missed. Thanks
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Tyler Street, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Back of garden, rugs dumped for over 9 months, 3rd February
item.description:
There is a rug dumped over the wall at end of garden near bbq area, been there for over 9 months and now there is another one dumped beside bbq on floor for over 2 weeks and now one inside main entrance. 3 rugs just left there. The garden with the hall .
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bethune Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very deep pothole around drain cover, 3rd February
item.description:
The rod needs an emergency fix as there's a very deep pothole
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ellenborough Road, North Cray, Greater London

item.title: Drainage system failed at Bexley Pump Track, 3rd February
item.description:
There is a drain on the far side of the pump track that is not draining rainwater properly therefore part of the track is flooded and currently unusable. This is dangerous for track users and could be hazardous to others in the park. This has been an issue since Autumn 2025. Please could I ask that the drain be fixed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Martens Avenue, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling, 3rd February
item.description:
The fenced off children’s play area, commonly called the football pitch. Dog fouling. Some is using the children’s playground as a dog toilet. I’ve also noticed dog fouling around the whole block, along Green Hundred Road. Every couple of metres there is dog mess. This is a new issue. We very rarely see dog fouling along this street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Friary Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
